history.content: This function uploads logo and watermark files to a Supabase storage bucket. It takes Inputs.LogoFile, Inputs.WatermarkFile, and Inputs.UserID as inputs. If neither the logo file nor the watermark file is provided, it triggers the Outputs.HandleCV output signal and returns. If one or both files are provided, it uploads each file to the 'resume_photos' bucket in Supabase storage under a directory named after the user ID. After each successful upload, it outputs the file path as Outputs.LogoPath or Outputs.WatermarkPath respectively. If there's an error during the upload, it sets the Outputs.Error output with the error message and triggers the Outputs.Failure output signal. After all uploads are done, it triggers the Outputs.Success output signal.

history.content: outputs width that changes over the course of 60 seconds to mimic a loading bar

This function simulates a loading bar by gradually increasing the Outputs.Width output over the course of 60 seconds. It starts by setting the initial width to 0. Then, it creates an interval that runs every second. In each interval, it increases the width by approximately 1.67 (which is 1/60th of the total width) and outputs the current width. When the width reaches 100 or more, it stops the interval and sends the Outputs.Success signal to indicate that the loading is complete.
Make it less linear

This function increases the width of an element in a non-linear manner over time. It starts with an initial width of 0 and a growth rate of 1/60th of the total width. Every second, the width is increased by the growth rate and the new width is outputted to the Outputs.Width output. When the width reaches 50, the growth rate doubles, causing the width to increase faster. When the width reaches 75, the growth rate is halved, slowing down the width increase. Once the width reaches or exceeds 100, the function stops increasing the width, clears the interval, and sends a signal through the Outputs.Success output.

history.content: Has an input for text. When run the text should be copied to the user's clipboard

This function takes a string of text from the Inputs.TextToCopy input and attempts to copy it to the user's clipboard using the Clipboard API. If the operation is successful, it triggers the Outputs.Success output signal. If the operation fails, it sets the Outputs.error output with the error message and triggers the Outputs.Failure output signal.
The input is actually a text node

This function attempts to copy a given text to the clipboard. It takes the text from the Inputs.TextToCopy input node. If the text is empty, the function will not proceed. It then tries to write this text to the clipboard using the navigator.clipboard.writeText method. If the text is successfully copied to the clipboard, it triggers the Outputs.Success output signal. If an error occurs during this process, it sets the error message to the Outputs.error output and triggers the Outputs.Failure output signal.
Has an input for text. When run the text should be copied to the user's clipboard

This function takes a string of text from the Inputs.TextToCopy input and attempts to copy it to the user's clipboard using the Clipboard API. If the operation is successful, it triggers the Outputs.Success output signal. If the operation fails, it sets the Outputs.error output with the error message and triggers the Outputs.Failure output signal.
The input is actually a text node

This function attempts to copy a given text to the clipboard. It takes the text from the Inputs.TextToCopy input node. If the text is empty, the function will not proceed. It then tries to write this text to the clipboard using the navigator.clipboard.writeText method. If the text is successfully copied to the clipboard, it triggers the Outputs.Success output signal. If an error occurs during this process, it sets the error message to the Outputs.error output and triggers the Outputs.Failure output signal.

parameters.functionScript: Outputs.JSON = Noodl.Object.get(Inputs.ID)

const supabase = Noodl.Variables.supabase;
const path = Inputs.Path;


const { data, error } = await supabase
  .storage
  .from('resume_photos')
  .createSignedUrl(path, 600)

Outputs.Source = data.signedUrl
Outputs.Success()

comments.text: This component is good for one-off media queries. In general it is better to use the queries defined in "Match Media Query"

roots.label: Check what breakpoints are currently in the Active Media Queries array

parameters.functionScript:
if (!Inputs.activeQueryArray) return

Outputs['Matches Small Mobile'] = Inputs.activeQueryArray.includes('Small Mobile')
Outputs['Matches Regular Mobile'] = Inputs.activeQueryArray.includes('Regular Mobile')
Outputs['Matches Tablet'] = Inputs.activeQueryArray.includes('Tablet')
Outputs['Matches Regular Desktop'] = Inputs.activeQueryArray.includes('Regular Desktop')
Outputs['Matches Large Desktop'] = Inputs.activeQueryArray.includes('Large Desktop')

comments.text: This component is used to detect the currently active media query.
"Small Mobile" and "Large Desktop" can be considered edge cases, so we combine all mobile and desktop checks as a shorthand.
This component shows the current content of the Active Media Queries array.

Media queries are created and cleaned up here. 

If you add queries, make sure to include them in the "Match Media Query" component as well.
Used to store an array of the identifiers for the media queries that are currently active

IMPORTANT:

This component should be placed in your home component. 

It should not be used more than once.
The default breakpoints can be edited here

dynamicports.name: inputMappingScript

parameters.functionScript:
if(!Inputs.Options) return // No options, no fun

Component.Object.Checkboxes = Inputs.Options.map((o,idx) => Noodl.Object.create({
    id:Component.Object.id+'-'+o,
    Value:o,
    Label:Inputs.Labels!==undefined?Inputs.Labels[idx]:o,
    Checked:Inputs.Selection!==undefined && Inputs.Selection.indexOf(o) !== -1
}))

Component.Object.Selection = Component.Object.Checkboxes.filter(o => o.Checked).map(o => o.Value)
Outputs.Changed()

history.content: Has an input for errors and an input for loading. If errors exists output error whether or not loading is true. If errors does not exist and loading is true output loading else output default

This function checks the status of a process and outputs the appropriate status message. It takes Inputs.Errors and Inputs.Loading as inputs. If there are any errors, it outputs the error message and triggers the Outputs.Error signal. If there are no errors but the process is still loading, it outputs "Loading..." and triggers the Outputs.Loading signal. If there are no errors and the process is not loading, it outputs "Default" and triggers the Outputs.Default signal.

parameters.functionScript: Outputs.ItemId = Noodl.Objects[Inputs.RowId].ItemId

comments.text:
This is the Table component. It extracts headers and the type of cells it should create from it's imput data.

The Group called "Header" contains a Repeater that creates the headers cells, and the group called "Rows" contains a repeater that creates rows based on the input data. 

If you want to change the border/divider between the Header Row and the rest of the table, select the group called "Header Row" and change the values for it's bottom border.

If you want to change the background color for the rows, go to the subcomponent called "Row". That is also where the cells are created. 

If you want to change the cell padding go to the subcomponent called "Base Cell" and change it there. Every type of cell is based on the Base Cell subcomponent.
If you want to chang the padding of all your cells, change it in the Base Cell Root node.

parameters.functionScript: Outputs.Blur()

dynamicports.name: inputMappingScript

parameters.functionScript: Outputs.backgroundColor = Inputs.ChildIndex%2?0:1

comments.text:
This component represents a row in the table. It has a repeater that creates the different cells that should be in each row.

If you want to add different borders/dividers between your rows, you can do that on the Row group using the Border property

This Color Blend node controls the background color of even or odd rows.

To change the even rows color, change the Color 0 property.

To change the odd row color, change the Color 1 attribute.

roots.label: Update the value of the object

parameters.functionScript:
const cell = Component.RepeaterObject

cell.Value = Inputs.Value

Noodl.Objects[cell.ItemId][cell.Field] = Inputs.Value

Noodl.Events.emit(Component.ParentObject.id + '-Table.CellChanged',{
    ItemId:cell.ItemId,
    Field:cell.Field,
    Value:Inputs.Value
})
Outputs.Blur()

history.content: sets a localStorage property called template to the input value

This function sets a value in the local storage of the browser under the key 'template'. It takes Inputs.Template as an input, which is the value to be stored. If the input is not provided or is an empty string, the function throws an error. If the value is successfully stored in the local storage, it triggers the Outputs.Success output signal. If there's an error while setting the value in the local storage, it sets the Outputs.error output with the error message and triggers the Outputs.Failure output signal.
gets the localStorage item called template and outputs it

This function retrieves a template from the local storage of the browser. It takes Inputs.TemplateName as an input, which is the name of the template to be retrieved. If no template name is provided, it defaults to 'default'. The function attempts to get the template from the local storage. If the template is not found, it throws an error. The retrieved template is then sent to the Outputs.Template output. If there is an error during the process, such as the template not being found, the error is sent to the Outputs.Error output and the Outputs.Failure signal is triggered.
gets the localStorage item called template and outputs it

This function retrieves a template from the local storage of the browser. It takes Inputs.TemplateName as an input, which is the name of the template to be retrieved. If no template name is provided, it defaults to 'default'. The function attempts to get the template from the local storage. If the template is not found, it throws an error. The retrieved template is then sent to the Outputs.Template output. If there is an error during the process, such as the template not being found, the error is sent to the Outputs.Error output and the Outputs.Failure signal is triggered.

history.content: has an input for a js file object. outputs a url for image source

This function takes a file object from the Inputs.File input, and creates a URL that represents the file object. This URL can be used as the source of an image. If the function is successful, it sets the URL to the Outputs.ImageUrl output and triggers the Outputs.Success output signal. If the function encounters an error, it sets the error to the Outputs.error output and triggers the Outputs.Failure output signal.
